intro: Anastraphia pauciflosculosa, commonly known as the few-flowered starflower, is a member of the Montiaceae family and is native to South America. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features fleshy, succulent leaves that help it conserve water in arid environments. Its flowers are typically blue or purple, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Anastraphia pauciflosculosa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
